intro: Psychotria axilliflora, commonly known as the "whispering plant," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria axilliflora is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids.
